definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Confused ghosts do not know what they are pious, they asked his sister.
sentences.chinese: 糊塗鬼不知道貌岸然它們在幹什麼，就問他姐姐。

sentences.english: He longed to throw off the mask of respectability.
sentences.chinese: 他渴望丟掉那副道貌岸然的僞裝。

sentences.english: Crime in full glory consolidates authority by the sacred fear it inspires.
sentences.chinese: 道貌岸然的罪行通過激發神聖的恐懼來鞏固權威。
我稱他們爲道貌岸然者。

sentences.english: We re learning to speak perfect English.
sentences.chinese: 我們是在學看說地道貌岸然的英語。

sentences.english: The sober priest, gazing down from on high, renders direction critical to his state's future.
sentences.chinese: 祭師道貌岸然，冷靜地指出他的國家重要的未來方向。

sentences.english: The sagacious minister offered what he considered a rather clever explanation .
sentences.chinese: 道貌岸然的牧師說了一套他認爲相當聰明的解釋。

sentences.english: The vicar preach to the congregation for half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 那位教區牧師向會衆講道貌岸然半個小時。

definition: lit. dressed up animal (idiom)/fig. immoral and despicable person
human face, beast's heart (idiom); two-faced/malicious and duplicitous
compassion, duty, propriety and integrity (idiom); all the traditional virtues/mainly used sarcastically, to mean hypocritical
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
